alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Conecuh; Escambia; Monroe; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Monroe, northeastern Washington, central Clarke, northwestern Escambia and southwestern Conecuh Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 445 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Saint Stephens to 10 miles northwest of Uriah. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Monroeville, Jackson, Frisco City, Leroy, Uriah, Whatley, Excel and I65 And AL 113. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
